Hey Lorena! Regarding the QA
I do see the successful call to `changePlanDeliveryDetails` but without a response from the endpoint (not sure if this is intentional)
But the call to subscriptions is being made with `deliveryTime` (check image)

From your instructions on how to QA I understood that the call to subscription should be without deliveryTime
>  and a call to PATCH /subscriptions without `deliveryTime` in the body
The account I used is rebecca.albers+4@hellofresh.com // 123456

Hey @U02BA3VS7H8 thanks for checking! For the response body it’s okay to be there - but it shouldn’t be in the payload body. I think that call you’re looking at is to GET subscriptions but the one with the id should be the PATCH

I see. But then in this case I can’t see any calls to PATCH subscription :thinking-2:
I just tested again and I have the same result as the screenshot.

Or when should I expect this call to PATCH subscriptions?
Here's what I see on my end
I believe that is the first request in your screenshot
Ah I understand now, sorry it was my bad
Np! Thanks for the review :praycat:

*Priority:* Medium :large_yellow_circle: 
*Topic:* Code Review

We are moving all program subscriptions to the end of the subscription list, so ideally it should not impact any code spaces. But would love your eyes on it, to confirm nothing in your space is impact.

thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible :blobthumbsup:

Meanwhile, please check our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.

Hey Philip! What do you mean with “program subscriptions” and “subscription list”?
Could you give more details on what exactly we should be keeping an eye on?

Hi @U02BA3VS7H8,
Thanks for looking at this.

Programs subscription is a new kind of Factor subscription that allows users to choose a meal plan around weight loss. This is determined by any subscription object that has `is_program_weightloss`  tag in the `subscription.productType.family.tags` object

Specifically, because a user can have multiple subscriptions, we had a scenario where the reactivation banner was being shown for a user with a standard active Factor subscription (because they had a deactivated program subscription). The solution was to move the Programs subscriptions to the end.

Ideally this should not impact users with a single subscription but it would impact users with multiple subscriptions especially for users with 1 active and 1 deactivate subscription. Validate
1.  the reactivation banner behavior doesn't change
2. Rewards/ Wallet section
3. Reactivation banner on the plans page (if any)
4. Share with Friends / Feed Friends section
5. Any other section that relies on order of subscriptions - such as banners
Ensure no side effects.

So I guess it’s not supre relevant for us because we don’t allow double subscriptions.
But we will keep an eye.

Thanks Philip

Merged the PR in will keep an eye out for any issues.
@U018UCEFJ65 /resolve.

Hi Tamir, thanks for your query
I have a question related to QA
With MWD account, I am able to test the modal (refer screenshot) :white_check_mark:

For BAU (refer screenshot 2), I can't the banner on which I can click :yellow-square:
creds: `bau+2@gc.com` pass:123456
could you check or let me know where i can test this?
thanks for testing @U044SKGT4R5. I don’t think I understand the issue. I am happy to check, but could you elaborate a bit about the expectation?

So I created a fresh account without any MWD voucher...
So as per PR description, I'm trying to test following points:

*BAU
• Should show the discount inline banner
• Should show the modal when clicked
• Modal should show 1 in progress, 2 left
I can't see any banner (refer second screenshot)... how can I test this?

sorry, I guess how I wrote it isn’t great. BAU for the banner is what I meant vs. any changed behaviour for it.

If you created an account without any multi week voucher and you don’t see the banner, that’s correct behaviour. it should only show if there are multiple discounts as I understand it, which you were able to confirm already
does that help or can I provide additional info?
Yeeep was in a meeting, that works :blob-ok: I'm just gonna approve :white_check_mark:
no worries, thanks for the review! I’ll make sure to have clear testing instructions on future PRs

thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible :blobthumbsup:

Meanwhile, please check our https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.

hey @U01B2LBUPND we got your request to swap index `293` for index `5` in all upcoming weeks (W37 onward) but we need up to which week you need this change

can you share this info please so i can generate it timely for you? thanks!
also feel free to raise these menu replacement requests here on our public channel so if we need to follow up with the request we can reach out easily in the thread :+1:
no worries! but let me know from W37 to which week i need to do these changes @U01B2LBUPND :slightly_smiling_face:
@U01B2LBUPND we have menus right now til W49 on CCM I see, should we do this W37 - W49 then?
Correct. 12 weeks out

in this particular case you mentioned we're doing the swap so that we can permanently discontinue the `293` SKU

does it mean after W49 we'd have to do the same swaps or when you create the next set of menus, can you directly replace it to index `5` yourself?

Because we're making the change on a relatively large time range (12 weeks), nearly all active customers are updated and we dont need to do it again.

That being said, reactivations can still see the discontinued product. That's usually a very very small number of orders and we monitor it so if it grows we'll do another swap.

If we wanted to fix this, we'd need to have a way to make the substitution in customers selections directly rather than in boxes
understood thanks for the context
okay it took a while but here you go all the replacements CVs @U01B2LBUPND :saluting-face:
Thank you bolo!!
